Title: Polish and Ukrainian TSOs extend increased firm gas capacity until September 2026
Description: Poland’s Gaz-System and Ukraine’s gas TSO of Ukraine (GTSOU) have agreed to extend the temporary increase of the offered firm capacity at the exit point toward Ukraine until September 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT to supply Centrica with LNG for 10 years
Description: UK’s Centrica and Thailand’s PTT have signed a heads of agreement for Centrica to supply LNG for a period of 10 years, commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: LNG traffic steady through Strait of Hormuz, but some vessels still idling offshore
Description: The flow of LNG ships transiting the Strait of Hormuz has remained steady this week following the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran, althought a few vessels are still idling near the strait and in the Gulf of Oman —possibly  indicating lingering caution in the area.
Author: CK

Title: Short-term lease of Germany’s Energos Force FSRU to Jordan spells further delays for Stade
Description: The 174,000 m³ Energos Force FSRU, chartered by the German federal government, is being redeployed to Jordan’s Aqaba LNG terminal under a short-term lease signed on June 25, Kpler has learned — the clearest indication yet that further delays are expected at Germany’s Stade LNG terminal, where the vessel was originally slated for deployment.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies eyes LNG bunkering fleet expansion with fourth vessel in 2026
Description: TotalEnergies is eyeing the expansion of its LNG bunkering fleet, with the addition of a fourth LNG bunker vessel set to enter service in late 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor ordered to prove safety before resuming work in Hammerfest LNG’s L201 area: regulator
Description: Norway’s offshore safety regulator has ordered Equinor to reassess and fully document the safety of operations at its 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant before resuming work in a section affected by repeated health incidents.
Author: CK
